meanings.definition: The process of screening or evaluating something in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prescreening of job applicants helps companies find the best candidates.
meanings.sent2: Before the movie starts, there is a prescreening to make sure everything is working properly.
meanings.sent3: The prescreening of contestants for the talent show revealed some surprising hidden talents.
meanings.sent4: The prescreening of potential dangers in the area saved many lives.
meanings.sent5: The prescreening of the documents was meticulous and thorough.

meanings.definition: The act of reviewing or examining something beforehand.
meanings.sent1: Prescreening the test questions can help students prepare better.
meanings.sent2: The prescreening of the new product showed promising results.
meanings.sent3: The prescreening of the menu items made the chef rethink his choices.
meanings.sent4: The prescreening of the evidence pointed towards a different suspect.
meanings.sent5: The prescreening of the budget revealed some unexpected expenses.
